monster.name: Sword Wraith Commander
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 241

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A sword wraith doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Martial Fury
trait.text: As a bonus action, the sword wraith can make one weapon attack, which deals an extra 9 (2d8) necrotic damage on a hit. If it does so, attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
trait.text: The sword wraith and any other sword wraiths within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sword wraith makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Call to Honor (1/Day)
action.text: To use this action, the sword wraith must have taken damage during the current combat. If the sword wraith can use this action, it gives itself advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn, and 1d4 + 1 sword wraith warriors appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. The warriors last until they drop to 0 hit points, and they take their turns immediately after the commander's turn on the same initiative count.

monster.name: Sword Wraith Warrior
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 241

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A sword wraith doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Martial Fury
trait.text: As a bonus action, the sword wraith can make one weapon attack. If it does so, attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 232

trait.name: Feline Agility
trait.text: When the tabaxi moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed until the end of the turn. Once it uses this ability, the tabaxi can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tabaxi makes two attacks with its claws, its shortsword, or its shortbow.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 233

trait.name: Feline Agility
trait.text: When the tabaxi moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed until the end of the turn. Once it uses this ability, the tabaxi can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Inspire (1/Day)
trait.text: While taking a short rest, the tabaxi can spend 1 minute singing, playing an instrument, telling a story, or reciting a poem to soothe and inspire creatures other than itself. Up to five creatures of the tabaxi's choice that can see and hear its performance gain 8 temporary hit points at the end of the tabaxi's short rest.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tabaxi makes two claws attacks or two dart attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage.

action.name: Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Talis the White

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Hoard of the Dragon Queen p. 93

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Talis has +1 scale mail and a wand of winter.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Talis has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Talis is a 9th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as her spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). Talis has the following spells prepared from the cleric spell list:
• Cantrips (at will): guidance, resistance, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): command, cure wounds, healing word, inflict wounds
• 2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, lesser restoration, spiritual weapon (spear)
• 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, mass healing word, sending
• 4th level (3 slots): death ward, freedom of movement
• 5th level (1 slot): insect plague

trait.name: Winter Strike (3/Day)
trait.text: Once per turn, when Talis hits with a melee attack, she can expend a use of this trait to deal an extra 9 (2d8) cold damage.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20 ft./60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: guidance, resistance, thaumaturgy, command, cure wounds, healing word, inflict wounds, blindness/deafness, lesser restoration, spiritual weapon, dispel magic, mass healing word, sending, death ward, freedom of movement, insect plague

monster.name: Tanarukk
monster.resist: fire, poison

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 186

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the tanarukk can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The tanarukk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tanarukk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its greatsword.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) piercing damage.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Unbridled Fury
reaction.text: In response to being hit by a melee attack, the tanarukk can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the attacker.

monster.name: Tarrasque
monster.immune: fire, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 286

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
trait.text: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tai l. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12+10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8+10) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d10+10) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d6+10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
Frightened:
• A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.
• The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.

If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone.
Blinded:
• A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The tarrasque can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. The tarrasque regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

monster.name: Tarul Var
monster.resist: cold, lightning, necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 244

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Focused Conjuration
trait.text: While Var is concentrating on a conjuration spell, his concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Var fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead .

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If Var is destroyed but his phylactery remains intact, Var gains a new body in ldlO days, regaining all his hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Var is a 12th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will):.fire bolt, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, unseen servant*
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, flaming sphere,* mirror image, scorching ray
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, dispel magic, fireball
4th level (3 slots): dimension door,* Evard's black tentacles*
5th level (3 slots): cloudkill,* scrying
6th level (1 slot): circle of death
*Conjuration spell of 1st level or higher.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: Var has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead .

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Paralyzed:
• A paralyzed creature is incapacitated, meaning it can't take actions or reactions, and can't move or speak.
• The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
• Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.

action.name: Benign Transposition
action.text: Var teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Alternatively, he can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is willing, both creatures teleport, swapping places. Var can use this feature again only after he finishes a long rest or casts a conjuration spell of 1st level or higher.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Var can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Var regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Cantrip
legendary.text: Var casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Var uses Paralyzing Touch .

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Var fixes his gaze on one creature he can see within 10 feet of him . The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Var's gaze for the next 24 hours.

monster.spells: fire bolt, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost, detect magic, magic missile, shield, unseen servant, detect thoughts, flaming sphere, mirror image, scorching ray, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball, dimension door, Evard's black tentacles, cloudkill, scrying, circle of death

monster.name: Tecuziztecatl
monster.resist: bludgeoning from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 245

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Tecuziztecatl can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Glowing
trait.text: Tecuziztecatl sheds dim light within 20 feet of itself.

trait.name: Flexible
trait.text: Tecuziztecatl can enter a space large enough for a Medium creature without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: Tecuziztecatl can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Tecuziztecatl makes two pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spit Acid (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Tecuziztecatl exhales acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Thayan Apprentice

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 245

trait.name: Doomvault Devotion
trait.text: Within the Doomvault, the apprentice has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened .

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The apprentice is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will) : fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp
1st level (4 slots): burning hands, detect magic, mage armor, shield
2nd level (3 slots) : blur, scorching ra

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, burning hands, detect magic, mage armor, shield , blur, scorching ray

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 246

trait.name: Doomvault Devotion
trait.text: Within the Doomvault, the warrior has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened .

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The warrior has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the warrior's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warrior makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1dlO + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: The Abbot
monster.resist: radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 225

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
trait.text: The Abbot's weapon attacks are magical. When the Abbot hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The Abbot's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The Abbot can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:
At will: detect evil and good
1/day each: commune, raise dead

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Abbot has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Abbot makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
action.text: The Abbot touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8+2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The Abbot magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the Abbot's choice).

In a new form, the Abbot retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

monster.name: The Angry
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 231

trait.name: Two Heads
trait.text: The Angry has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Rising Anger
trait.text: If another creature deals damage to the Angry, the Angry's attack rolls have advantage until the end of its next turn, and the first time it hits with a hook attack on its next turn, the attack's target takes an extra 19 (3d12) psychic damage.
On its turn, the Angry has disadvantage on attack rolls if no other creature has dealt damage to it since the end of its last turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Angry makes two hook attacks.

action.name: Hook
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: The Hungry
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 232

trait.name: Life Hunger
trait.text: If a creature the Hungry can see regains hit points, the Hungry gains two benefits until the end of its next turn: it has advantage on attack rolls, and its bite deals an extra 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a hit.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Hungry makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 16) and restrained until the grapple ends. While grappling a creature, the Hungry can't attack with its claws.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

monster.name: The Lonely
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 232

trait.name: Psychic Leech
trait.text: At the start of each of the Lonely's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

trait.name: Thrives on Company
trait.text: The Lonely has advantage on attack rolls while it is within 30 feet of at least two other creatures. It otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Lonely makes one harpoon arm attack and uses Sorrowful Embrace.

action.name: Harpoon Arm
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. The Lonely has two harpoon arms and can grapple up to two creatures at once.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.

action.name: Sorrowful Embrace
action.text: Each creature grappled by the Lonely must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. A creature takes 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In either case, the Lonely pulls each creature grappled by it up to 30 feet straight toward it.

monster.name: The Lost
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 233

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Lost makes two arm spike attacks.

action.name: Arm Spike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Embrace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to it, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is frightened, and it takes 27 (6d8) psychic damage at the end of each of its turns. The Lost can embrace only one creature at a time.
Frightened:
• A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.
• The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.

reaction.name: Tightening Embrace
reaction.text: If the Lost takes damage while it has a creature grappled, that creature takes 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

monster.name: The Pudding King
monster.resist: acid, poison

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Out of the Abyss p. 233

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The Pudding King has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: The Pudding King has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The Pudding King's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: nondetection (self only)
1/day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self

trait.name: Insanity
trait.text: The Pudding King has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The Pudding King is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The Pudding King knows the following sorcerer spells:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, light, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): false life, mage armor, ray of sickness, shield
2nd level (3 slots): crown of madness, misty step
3rd level (3 slots): gaseous form, stinking cloud
4th level (3 slots): blight, confusion
5th level (1 slot): cloudkill

action.name: War Pick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The Pudding King magically transforms into an ooze, or back into his true form. He reverts to his true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. In ooze form, the Pudding King retains his alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. His statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form.

action.name: Create Green Slime (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: The Pudding King creates a patch of green slime (see "Dungeon Hazards" in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide). The slime appears on a section of wall, ceiling, or floor within 30 feet of the Pudding King.

monster.spells: acid splash, blindness/deafness, blur, disguise, light, mage hand, nondetection, poison spray, prestidigitation, false life, mage armor, ray of sickness, shield, crown of madness, misty step, gaseous form, stinking cloud, blight, confusion, cloudkill

monster.name: The Wretched
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing while in dim light or darkness

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 233

trait.name: Wretched Pack Tactics
trait.text: The Wretched has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Wretched's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated. The Wretched otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage, and the Wretched attaches to the target. While attached, the Wretched can't attack, and at the start of each of the Wretched's turns, the target takes 6 (1d10 + 1) necrotic damage.

The attached Wretched moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the Wretched's movement. The Wretched can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach a Wretched.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 246

trait.name: Adhesive Blossoms
trait.text: The thorn slinger adheres to anything that touches it. A Medium or smaller creature adhered to the thorn slinger is also grappled by it (escape DC 11). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.
At the end of each of the thorn slinger's turns, anything grappled by it takes 3 (1d6) acid damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the thorn slinger remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate bush.

action.name: Thorns
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.name: Thorny
monster.resist: lightning, piercing

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 197

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
trait.text: The thorny has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The thorny regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the thorny’s next turn. The thorny dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6+1) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 288

trait.name: Chameleon Carapace
trait.text: The thri-kreen can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The thri-kreen's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The thri-kreen makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Paralyzed:
• A paralyzed creature is incapacitated, meaning it can't take actions or reactions, and can't move or speak.
• The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
• Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.
Poisoned:
• A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4+1) slashing damage.

action.name: Variant: Weapons Multiattack
action.text: The thri-kreen makes two gythka attacks or two chatkcha attacks.

action.name: Variant: Gythka
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8+1) slashing damage.

action.name: Variant: Chatkcha
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) slashing damage.

At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible)
2/day each: blur, magic weapon
1/day: invisibility (self only)

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Bite

If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Paralyzed:
• A paralyzed creature is incapacitated, meaning it can't take actions or reactions, and can't move or speak.

• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
• Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.
Poisoned:

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 350

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The thug makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

monster.name: Thurl Merosska

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Princes of the Apocalypse p. 192

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Thurl is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). Thurl knows the following sorcerer spells:
• Cantrips (at will): friends, gust, light, message, ray of frost
• 1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, feather fall, jump
• 2nd level (3 slots): levitate, misty step
• 3rd level (2 slots): haste

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Thurl makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Lance
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12+3) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Thurl adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Thurl must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.spells: friends, gust, light, message, ray of frost, expeditious retreat, feather fall, jump, levitate, misty step, haste

monster.name: Tiamat
monster.immune: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, poisoned, stunned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: The Rise of Tiamat p. 92

trait.name: Discorporation
trait.text: When Tiamat drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to her domain in the Nine Hells, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (3/Day)
trait.text: Tiamat can innately cast divine word (spell save DC 26). Her spellcasting ability is Charisma.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
trait.text: If Tiamat fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
trait.text: Unless she wishes to be affected, Tiamat is immune to spells of 6th level or lower. She has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Tiamat's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
trait.text: Tiamat can take one reaction per turn, rather than only one per round. She also has advantage on saving throws against being knocked unconscious. If she fails a saving throw against an effect that would stun a creature, one of her unspent legendary actions is spent.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Tiamat regains 30 hit points at the start of her turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Tiamat can use her Frightful Presence. She then makes three attacks: two with her claws and one with her tail.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d6+10) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8+10) piercing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of Tiamat's choice that is within 240 feet of Tiamat and aware of her must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Tiamat's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
Frightened:
• A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.
• The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Tiamat can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Tiamat regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Bite
legendary.text: Tiamat can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options listed. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Tiamat regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Tiamat's legendary action options are associated with her five dragon heads (a bite and a breath weapon for each). Once Tiamat chooses a legendary action option for one of her heads, she can't choose another one associated with that head until the start of her next turn.

Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d10+10) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage (black dragon head), lightning damage (blue dragon head), poison damage (green dragon head), fire damage (red dragon head), or cold damage (white dragon head).

legendary.name: Black Dragon Head: Acid Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Tiamat breathes acid in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Blue Dragon Head: Lightning Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Tiamat breathes lightning in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 (16d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Green Dragon Head: Poison Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Tiamat breathes poisonous gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 Constitution saving throw, taking 77 (22d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Red Dragon Head: Fire Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Tiamat breathes fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 (26d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: White Dragon Head: Cold Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Tiamat breathes an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw, taking 72 (16d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: divine word

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 339
Player's Handbook, p. 311

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the tiger moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage.

monster.name: Tiny Servant
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Xanathar's Guide to Everything, p. 169

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Titivilus
monster.resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren’t silvered

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 178

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Titivilus's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: alter self, animate dead, bestow curse, confusion, major image, modify memory, nondetection, sending, suggestion
3/day each: greater invisibility (self only), mislead
1/day each: feeblemind, symbol (discord or sleep only)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Titivilus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Titivilus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Titivilus's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Titivilus regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Titivilus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Ventiloquism
trait.text: Whenever Titivilus speaks, he can choose a point within 60 feet; his voice emanates from that point.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Titivilus makes one sword attack and uses his Frightful Word once.

action.name: Silver Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage it takes.

action.name: Frightful Word
action.text: Titivilus targets one creature he can see within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of him for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the target must take the Dash action and move away from Titivilus by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the Dash action. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Frightened:
• A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.
• The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

action.name: Teleport
action.text: Titivilus magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

action.name: Twisting Words
action.text: Titivilus targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Charisma saving throw or become charmed by Titivilus for 1 minute. The charmed target can repeat the saving throw if Titivilus deals any damage to it. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to Titivilus's Twisting Words for 24 hours.
Charmed:
• A charmed creature can't attack the charmer or target the charmer with harmful abilities or magical effects.
• The charmer has advantage on any ability check to interact socially with the creature.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Titivilus can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Titivilus regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Assault (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Titivilus attacks with his silver sword or uses his Frightful Word.

legendary.name: Corrupting Guidance
legendary.text: Titivilus uses Twisting Words. Alternatively, he targets one creature charmed by him that is within 60 feet of him; that charmed target must make a DC 21 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, Titivilus decides how the target acts during its next turn.

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: Titivilus uses his Teleport action.

monster.spells: alter self, animate dead, bestow curse, confusion, major image, modify memory, nondetection, sending, suggestion, greater invisibility, mislead, feeblemind, symbol

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 193

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tlincalli makes two attacks: one with its longsword or spiked chain, and one with its sting.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10+3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Spiked Chain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 11) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tlincalli can’t use the spiked chain against another target.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Sting
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If it fails the saving throw by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Paralyzed:
• A paralyzed creature is incapacitated, meaning it can't take actions or reactions, and can't move or speak.
• The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
• Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.
Poisoned:
• A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

monster.name: Topi
monster.resist: bludgeoning
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: The Tortle Package, p. 22

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The topi has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the topi to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the topi drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Venomous Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of the target's next turn.
Poisoned:
• A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: The Tortle Package, p. 23
Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 242

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

action.name: Shell Defense
action.text: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is prone, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

monster.name: Tortle Druid

trait.name: Source
trait.text: The Tortle Package, p. 23
Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, p. 242

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The tortle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The tortle is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, guidance, produce flame
1st level (4 slots): animal friendship, cure wounds, speak with animals, thunderwave
2nd level (3 slots): darkvision, hold person

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Shell Defense
action.text: The tortle withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortle is prone, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, produce flame, animal friendship, cure wounds, speak with animals, thunderwave, darkvision, hold person

monster.name: Transmuter

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 218

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The transmuter is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The transmuter has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): light, mending, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, expeditious retreat*, mage armor
2nd level (3 slots): alter self*, hold person, knock*
3rd level (3 slots): blink*, fireball, slow*
4th level (3 slots): polymorph*, stoneskin
5th level (1 slot): telekinesis*
*Transmutation spell of 1st level or higher

trait.name: Transmuter's Stone
trait.text: The transmuter carries a magic stone it crafted that grants its bearer one of the following effects:
•Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet
•An extra 10 feet of speed while the bearer is unencumbered
•Proficiency with Constitution saving throws
•Resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (transmuter’s choice whenever the transmuter chooses this benefit)
If the transmuter has the stone and casts a transmutation spell of 1st level or higher, it can change the effect of the stone.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6-1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8-1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

monster.spells: light, mending, prestidigitation, ray of frost, chromatic orb, expeditious retreat, mage armor, alter self, hold person, knock , blink, fireball, slow, polymorph, stoneskin, telekinesis

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 194

trait.name: Fake Appearance
trait.text: While the trapper is attached to a ceiling, floor, or wall and remains motionless, it is almost indistinguishable from an ordinary section of ceiling, floor, or wall. A creature that can see it and succeeds on a DC 20 Intelligence (investigation) or Intelligence (Nature) check can discern its presence.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The trapper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Smother
action.text: One Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of the trapper must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 14). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 17 (4d6+3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. While grappled in this way, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating. The trapper can smother only one creature at a time.
Blinded:
• A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

monster.name: Treant
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 289

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the treant remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The treant makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6+6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10+6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
action.text: The treant magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

monster.name: Tree Blight
monster.languages: understands Common and Druidic but doesn't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Curse of Strahd p. 230

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dead tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The blight deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The blight makes four attacks: two with its branches and two with its grasping roots, If it has a target grappled, the blight can also make a bite attack against the target as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) piercing damage.

action.name: Branch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit (3d6+6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Grasping Root
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature not grappled by the blight. Hit: the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 9 (1d6+6) bludegoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The root has AC 15 and can be severed by dealing 6 slashing damage or more to it at once. Cutting the root doesn't hurt the blight but ends the grapple.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 242

trait.name: Detect Invisibility
trait.text: Within 60 feet of the tressym, magical invisibility fails to conceal anything from the tressym's sight.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The tressym has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Poison Sense
trait.text: A tressym can detect whether a substance is poisonous by taste, touch, or smell.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 234

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tri-flower frond uses its orange blossom, then its yellow blossom, and then its red blossom.

action.name: Orange Blossom
action.text: The tri-flower frond chooses one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. While poisoned in this way, the target is unconscious. At the end of each minute, the poisoned target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Poisoned:
• A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
Unconscious:
• An unconscious creature is incapacitated, meaning it can't take actions or reactions, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
• The creature drops whatever it's holding and falls prone.
• The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
• Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.

action.name: Yellow Blossom
action.text: The tri-flower frond chooses one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, or it is covered with corrosive sap and takes 5 acid damage at the start of each of its turns. Dousing the target with water reduces the acid damage by 1 point per pint or flask of water used.

action.name: Red Blossom
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 11). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 5 (2d4) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The red blossom can grapple only one target at a time. Another creature within reach of the tri-flower frond can use its action to end the grapple on the target.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.

monster.name: Tribal Warrior

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 350

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The warrior has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the warrior's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8+1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monster.environment: arctic, coastal, desert, forest, grassland, hill, mountain, swamp, underdark

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 80

trait.name: Trampling Charge
trait.text: If the triceratops moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the triceratops can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8+6) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 22 (3d10+6) bludgeoning damage

trait.name: Source

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
trait.text: The tridrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Disintegration
trait.text: If the tridrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tridrone makes three fist attacks or three javelin attacks.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) piercing damage.

trait.name: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 ft. of the troglodyte must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.
Poisoned:
• A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troglodyte makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) slashing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Out of the Abyss p. 229

trait.name: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troglodyte must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.
Poisoned:
• A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troglodyte makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with either its claws or its greatclub.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4+4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4+4) slashing damage.

action.name: Greatclub
action.text: Melee Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
action.text: The troglodyte spits acid in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Troll

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 291

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Variant: Loathsome Limbs
trait.text: Whenever the troll takes at least 15 slashing damage at one time, roll a d20 to determine what else happens to it:
1-10: Nothing else happens.
11-14: One leg is severed from the troll if it has any legs left.
15- 18: One arm is severed from the troll if it has any arms left.
19-20: The troll is decapitated, but the troll dies only if it can't regenerate. If it dies, so does the severed head.

If the troll finishes a short or long rest without reattaching a severed limb or head, the part regrows. At that point, the severed part dies. Until then, a severed part acts on the troll's initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 13, 10 hit points, and the troll's Regeneration trait.
A severed leg is unable to attack and has a speed of 5 feet.

A severed arm has a speed of 5 feet and can make one claw attack on its turn, with disadvantage on the attack roll unless the troll can see the arm and its target. Each time the troll loses an arm, it loses a claw attack.

If its head is severed, the troll loses its bite attack and its body is blinded unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of 0 feet and the troll's Keen Smell trait. It can make a bite attack but only against a target in its space.

The troll's speed is halved if it's missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls prone. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.
Blinded:
• A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
Prone:
• A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
• The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
• An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) slashing damage.
